bibl.title: Ancient Head Lice on a Wooden Comb from Antinoë, Egypt.
bibl.note: Seven head lice (Pediculus humanus capitis De Geer, 1778) were recovered from the debris found among the fine teeth of a wooden comb excavated in Antinoë (Vth-VIth centuries A.D.).
bibl.seg: PALMA Ricardo L., Ancient Head Lice on a Wooden Comb from Antinoë, Egypt.
Seven head lice (Pediculus humanus capitis De Geer, 1778) were recovered from the debris found among the fine teeth of a wooden comb excavated in Antinoë (Vth-VIth centuries A.D.).
